intro: Populus intermedia, commonly known as the European aspen, is a deciduous tree native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its white bark and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in catkins, which are pollinated by wind. Its leaves are typically serrated and turn yellow in the fall before dropping. Populus intermedia is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in a variety of forested environments.
